Digital regulation: Thierry Breton faces sanctions as US-EU dispute intensifies
subhead: Former EU commissioner Thierry Breton, who led tech sector regulation efforts, is now barred from having a US visa. The Trump administration condemned the EU's online content moderation measures as 'censorship.'

'Drone overflights are testing our defense capabilities,' says French military intelligence and security chief
subhead: Despite heightened vigilance from his teams, General Aymeric Bonnemaison, director of the French military security agency, admits that it remains difficult to identify the culprits of suspicious incidents. Since September, there has been a sharp increase in drone overflights of military installations.

title: Ukraine loses Siversk, a bastion guarding the last quarter of the Donetsk region
subhead: The Russian invading army has completed its occupation of the city of 10,000 inhabitants, which had held out for three and a half years. The eastern flank of the last conurbation in the Donbas that is still under Ukrainian control now seems exposed.

title: Israel NGO registration rules could lead to collapse of aid into Gaza
subhead: New administrative rules imposed on international organizations have already led to the exclusion of several groups from the Palestinian enclave. Humanitarian actors say they are deeply concerned for civilians.

title: In New York, the invasion of drunken Santas
subhead: 'My Christmas under Trump' (3/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. In her latest dispatch, she dives into the Santa Claus convention, where every December 13, locals dress up in honor of the mythical bearded figure – a perfect pretext for a marathon bar crawl.

title: Disneyland Paris at 40: When Mickey Mouse said 'bonjour' to Paris
subhead: On December 18, 1985, the Walt Disney Company approved the construction of its first European theme park in Marne-la-Vallée, about 30 kilometers east of Paris. The prime minister secured the deal after tough negotiations between envoys from the Socialist government and an American corporation seen as the embodiment of ruthless capitalism.
